name: Blackout Crew
description:
The '''Blackout Crew''' are a [[UK hard house#Donk|donk]]/[[rapping|rap]] group originally featuring 5 rap artists, formed from the Bards of Oldham – Jordan Cover, Kevin Allison, Rob Davis, Zak Kabbani and Kurtis Chadwick – from [[Halliwell, Bolton, Greater Manchester]]. 

Their 2009 album ''Time 2 Shine'' peaked at No. 42 in the UK. Their album contained three singles: "Bbbounce", "Put a Donk on It" and "Dialled".

The lines "You know what you wanna do with that, right? You wanna put a bangin' donk on it" were frequently used in the opening of the [[BBC Radio 2]]/[[BBC Radio 6 Music]] programme ''[[Radcliffe & Maconie]]'', being generally favoured by [[Mark Radcliffe (radio broadcaster)|Mark Radcliffe]].{{Citation needed|date=September 2020}} The Blackout Crew worked with electronic group [[Metronomy]] to provide a B-side remix for their 2008 single "A Thing for Me".

In 2023, [[Jax Jones]] released the single "[[Won't Forget You (Jax Jones, D.O.D and Ina Wroldsen song)|Won't Forget You]]" with [[D.O.D. (DJ)|D.O.D.]] and [[Ina Wroldsen]], which was shortly followed by a "Donk Edit" featuring Kurtis Chadwick (MC Viper), Jordan Cover (MC Cover) and Luke Purcell (MC Lukey P) from the newly reformed Blackout Crew, which peaked at number 28 on 16 November 2023 in the UK, far surpassing the original edit's peak of number 82 on 9 November 2023.
